New Records: Phil Salt scored the joint-most expensive over by a West Indian in a T20 World Cup, hitting Romario Shepherd for 30 runs in an over.
Key Match Events: Phil Salt scored an unbeaten 87 off 38 balls.
Adil Rashid took 1 for 21 from his four overs.
Rovman Powell hit three sixes in an over off Liam Livingstone before getting out.
Andre Russell was caught off Adil Rashid.
Phil Salt hit Romario Shepherd for 30 runs in an over.
Brandon King retired hurt after scoring 23 off 12 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler won the toss and elected to bowl first.
Rovman Powell mentioned he would have chosen to bowl first as well.
West Indies made two changes: Roston Chase and Romario Shepherd came in.
England made one change: Mark Wood replaced Chris Jordan.
Both teams expected a high-scoring match on a good batting deck.
Post-Match Reflections: Adil Rashid expressed satisfaction with the team's bowling performance, stating that 180 was a par score.
The match highlighted England's strong performance and set a marker for other teams in the Super Eight stage.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Daren Sammy National Stadium in St Lucia.
The weather was hot with one brief shower in the afternoon.
The ground had a lopsided dimension with 63 meters square on one side and 72 meters on the other.
The wind was expected to minimize the risk of taking on the longer side.
